repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body: This is only correct when pasting in Insert mode or on an empty line, not correct when pasting in Normal or Visual mode on a non-empty line. And the mark should not be set at all when in Cmdline mode.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -329,6 +330,7 @@ do
       vim.api.nvim_command(('echo "%s"'):format(dots))
     end
     if is_last_chunk then
+      vim.fn.setpos("'[", assert(startpos))

comment_data.body: Instead, consider using `getpos("'[")` after pasting the first chunk instead.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -329,6 +330,7 @@ do
       vim.api.nvim_command(('echo "%s"'):format(dots))
     end
     if is_last_chunk then
+      vim.fn.setpos("'[", assert(startpos))

comment_data.body: I think the code in the function before has returned when in `cmdline` mode.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -329,6 +330,7 @@ do
       vim.api.nvim_command(('echo "%s"'):format(dots))
     end
     if is_last_chunk then
+      vim.fn.setpos("'[", assert(startpos))

comment_data.body:
This isn't correct, as when the first chunk is empty the next non-empty chunk's `'[` mark should be used. I think it should be like this:
- Initialize `startpos` to `nil` and set it to `nil` again after pasting the last chunk
- After pasting a chunk, set `startpos` to `getpos("'[")` only if it previously is `nil`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -254,6 +254,7 @@ do
       lines = { '' }
     end
     if #lines == 1 and lines[1] == '' and not is_last_chunk then
+      startpos = vim.fn.getpos("'[")

comment_data.body: Yeah, sorry, I am working on this, I should change this pr into a draft pr
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -254,6 +254,7 @@ do
       lines = { '' }
     end
     if #lines == 1 and lines[1] == '' and not is_last_chunk then
+      startpos = vim.fn.getpos("'[")

comment_data.body: `startpos` can't be `nil` here, as the previous assignment has already set it to non-`nil`, so the `if startpos` condition isn't needed.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -328,7 +328,12 @@ do
       -- message when there are zero dots.
       vim.api.nvim_command(('echo "%s"'):format(dots))
     end
+    startpos = startpos == nil and vim.fn.getpos("'[") or startpos
     if is_last_chunk then
+      if startpos then
+        vim.fn.setpos("'[", startpos)
+        startpos = nil
+      end

comment_data.body: But actually there is another way: when there is only one chunk, don't call `getpos("'[")` or `setpos("'[")` at all, i.e., move the assignment to the `else` branch of the `if is_last_chunk`.

+        startpos = nil

comment_data.body:
> But actually there is another way: when there is only one chunk, don't call `getpos("'[")` or `setpos("'[")` at all, i.e., move the assignment to the `else` branch of the `if is_last_chunk`.

when the chunk is the only chunk, the `startpos` would be nil if we move the assignment into the `else` branch

comment_data.body: This chunk has phase `3`, but it doesn't have a corresponding chunk with phase `1`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -853,6 +853,61 @@ describe('API', function()
         feed('u') -- Undo.
         expect(expected1)
       end)
+      it('stream: multiple chunks sets the correct mark [', function()
+        api.nvim_paste('1/chunk 1 (start)\n', true, 1)
+        eq({ 0, 1, 1, 0 }, fn.getpos("'["))
+        api.nvim_paste('1/chunk 2\n', true, 2)
+        eq({ 0, 2, 1, 0 }, fn.getpos("'["))
+        api.nvim_paste('1/chunk 3 (end)\n', true, 3)

+          1/chunk 2
+          1/chunk 3 (end)
+          ]]

+        eq({ 0, 1, 1, 0 }, fn.getpos("'["))
+        api.nvim_paste('aaaaaa', true, -1)
+        eq({ 0, 4, 1, 0 }, fn.getpos("'["))
+        api.nvim_paste('bbbbbb', true, 1)
+        eq({ 0, 4, 7, 0 }, fn.getpos("'["))
+        api.nvim_paste('cccccc', true, 2)
+        eq({ 0, 4, 13, 0 }, fn.getpos("'["))
+        api.nvim_paste('dddddd\n', true, 3)
+        eq({ 0, 4, 7, 0 }, fn.getpos("'["))
+        expected1 = [[
+          1/chunk 1 (start)
+          1/chunk 2
+          1/chunk 3 (end)
+          aaaaaabbbbbbccccccdddddd
+          ]]
+        expect(expected1)
+        -- Only pastes an empty line
+        api.nvim_paste('', true, -1)
+        eq({ 0, 5, 1, 0 }, fn.getpos("'["))
+        api.nvim_paste('', true, 3)

comment_data.body: *During* a stream, I think the `'[` marks should be set to the "correct" position. It shouldn't be temporarily wrong. WDYT?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -853,6 +853,59 @@ describe('API', function()
         feed('u') -- Undo.
         expect(expected1)
       end)
+      it("stream: multiple chunks sets correct '[ mark", function()

+        eq({ 0, 1, 1, 0 }, fn.getpos("'["))
+        api.nvim_paste('aaaaaa', true, -1)
+        eq({ 0, 4, 1, 0 }, fn.getpos("'["))
+        api.nvim_paste('bbbbbb', true, 1)
+        eq({ 0, 4, 7, 0 }, fn.getpos("'["))
+        api.nvim_paste('cccccc', true, 2)
+        eq({ 0, 4, 13, 0 }, fn.getpos("'["))

comment_data.body:
Why check `startpos` instead of `phase == 2 or phase == 3` ? 

We can call `setpos()` always during phase 2/3. That ensures the `'[` mark is always correct during a stream, instead of being temporarily wrong until the last chunk.

```suggestion
      if phase == 2 or phase == 3 then
        vim.fn.setpos("'[", assert(startpos))
        startpos = nil
```

       vim.api.nvim_command(('echo "%s"'):format(dots))
     end
     if is_last_chunk then
+      if startpos then
+        vim.fn.setpos("'[", startpos)
+        startpos = nil

```suggestion
    elseif startpos == 1 then
      startpos = vim.fn.getpos("'[")
```

comment_data.body:
Again, there is no need to restore the same position that was just saved.
```suggestion
    else
      vim.fn.setpos("'[", startpos)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -328,7 +328,14 @@ do
       -- message when there are zero dots.
       vim.api.nvim_command(('echo "%s"'):format(dots))
     end
+    if startpos == nil then
+      startpos = vim.fn.getpos("'[")
+    end
+    if phase == 2 or phase == 3 then
+      vim.fn.setpos("'[", assert(startpos))

comment_regular_data.body:
In summary,
1. If the `startpos` is nil, set `startpos` as `vim.fn.getpos("'[")` which means the first **non-empty** chunk has been pasted.
2. If the `startpos` isn't nil, set the `'[` mark as `startpos` which means we are pasting **not-first-chunk-and-non-empty** chunks.
3. Reset `startpos` after we pasted the last chunk

Note,
1. `startpos == nil` is not equal to `phase == 1` because there may be some empty chunks pasted which won't arrive here (**was returned at code before**)).

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix: set correct '[ mark when pasting chunks
